Verify the Alerts on Dashboard

  • Alerts with red dot which are not read

testcase.name: Check the Functionality of Additional Funds to PostPayAccount Alert
testcase.summary: Check the Functionality of Additional Funds to PostPayAccount Alert

step.actions: 1. Verify the Alert for the Post Pay Account
step.expectedresults: 1. Alerts should not trigger for the post pay account

testcase.name: Check the Functionality of Additional Funds to PrePayAccount Alert
testcase.summary: Check the Functionality of Additional Funds to PrePayAccount Alert

step.actions: 1. Verify the reasons for the Additional Funds to Account Alert to trigger
step.expectedresults:
1. Additional Funds Alert should trigger if the Accounts funds are 
  • Low (If the Accounts remaining are <$500)
  • Zero
  • Negative

step.actions:
Check for Alert trigger when the Budget is <$ 500 for Prepay Account by

  1. Login to Mission Ctrl
  • Create  PrePay  Account with $5000 as Lifetime Funds
  • Login to Grow as the user of the above Account 
  • Create a Campaign with Bit Type as Impression and Bid Value 0.02
  • Configure the E2E test data and using API testing send the request to point to the above created Campaign until the remaining budget comes down to <500.
  1. or Update the "totalspent" field of the Campaign in the DB by 
  • Create  a Campaign in the above Account, with Total Spend value 5000
  • Update the "totalspent" field  to 4600 in the DB so that the Budget Remaining will be 400 which is less tahn <500
  • Wait for 24 hrs and check for the Alert

Test Data:

Account ID: 5a6100bb72095a0011f36987

Campaign ID : 5c5dfb357732bd001034708a

Remaining Funds = Lifetime Funds - OverallSpent(All the Campaigns under the Account)

Need to update the TotalSpent field of the CAmpaign in the DB
step.expectedresults:
1. Additional funds Alert should trigger.
  2. Alert should trigger

step.actions:
Check the functionality of the Alert after adding funds to the Account.

  1. ​Click on Alert
  2. Add more funds and save
  3. Check for the Alert after 24hrs
step.expectedresults:
1. Alert should be greyed out and User should be directed to the Accounts page
  2. Account Funds should be updated
  3. Alert should not trigger again next day

testcase.name: Check the functionality of Campaign tracking installs Alert
testcase.summary: Campaign tracking installs Alert

step.actions: 1. Verify the reasons for the Campaign tracking Installs Alert to trigger
step.expectedresults: 1. Campaign tracking Installs Alert should trigger if CPI Campaign with > 100 clicks and exactly 0 installs

step.actions:
Check for the  Campaign tracking Installs Alert by

  1. Modify the the field "clicks" in the Mongo DB for a Campaign you want to test the Alert  to >100 and  0 Installs 
  2. Configure the testdata on the AdvertiserSelfServe and Perform the E2E test using API Testing  and send the request more than 100 times and check
  3. Modify the the field "clicks" in the Mongo DB for  a Campaign you want to test the Alert  to >100 and  and Installs >0
step.expectedresults:
1. Alert should show up and when clicking on Alert should take the user to the tracking page of the Campaign
  2. Alert should trigger and user should be directed to the Tracking Page.
  3. Alert should not trigger

testcase.name: Check the Functionality of Decrease in Win rate Alert
testcase.summary: Check the Functionality of Decrease in Win rate Alert
testcase.preconditions: 14 days of data should be available to test

step.actions: Verify the reasons for the Win Rate Alert
step.expectedresults: WinRate for a campaign has dropped by >30% WoW.

step.actions:
Verify the Winrate for a Campaign  WoW

  1. Compare the Average Win Rate of First Week and Second Week and if it is dropped by >30% then 
  2. Compare the Average Win Rate of First Week and Second Week and if it is dropped by >20% then 
  3. Compare the Average Win Rate of First Week and Second Week and if it is dropped by >5% then
step.expectedresults:
1. Win Rate Alert should trigger
  2. Alert should not trigger

testcase.name: Check the functionality of Decrease in Spend Alert
testcase.summary: Check the functionality of Decrease in Spend Alert
testcase.preconditions: 14 days of data should be available to test this Alert

step.actions: 1. Verify the reasons for the Alert to trigger
step.expectedresults: 1. If the spend for a Campaign has dropped by a large amount

step.actions:
Verify the steps  to test for the Decrease in Spend Alert

  1. Compare the two weeks spend and if the previous week spend is >$500 then 
  2. Compare the two weeks spend and if the previous week spend is <$500 then
step.expectedresults:
1. Alert should Trigger and user should be directed to the Campaign Bid/Budget Page
  2. Alert should not trigger

testcase.name: Check the Functionality of Additional Funds to Campaign Alert

step.actions: 1. Verify the reasons for the Additional Funds to Account Alert to trigger
step.expectedresults:
1. Additional Funds Alert should trigger if the Campaign funds are 
  • If the Campaign funds remaining are <$100

step.actions:
Check for Alert trigger when the Campaign fund is <100 by

  1. Modify the "Totalspendlimit" and "Totalspent" fields for a Campaign  in the QA  Mongo DB so that Budget Remaining field on the UI will be  <100 or zero or negative .
  2. Login to Grow and check for the Alert

Calculation of Budget Remaining : 

totalSpendLimit - totalSpent
step.expectedresults: 1. Alert should trigger for the Campaign for which the funds are less than 100 and user should be directed to the Campaign Bid/Budget Page when clicked on Alert.

testcase.name: Check the Functionality of Upload new Creatives Alert
testcase.summary: Test the functionality of new Creatives Alert
testcase.preconditions: Campaign should not have new Creatives

step.actions: 1. Verify the reasons for Upload new Creatives Alert to trigger
step.expectedresults: 1. Upload new Creatives Alert should trigger when no new creative has been added in 60 days.

step.actions:
Check for Alert trigger when no new Creatives has been added to the Application  in 60 days by

  1. If this value of theis query  comes back 0 that means there were 0 creatives created in the last 60 days for the defined Application.

db.creatives.find({application: ObjectId("50f043f9f96aab216b00e6ee"), created: {$gte: new Date(new Date().setDate(new Date().getDate() - 60))}}).count()

  1. Finding all the Applications with zero Creatives in last 60 days by using following query

var recent = db.creatives.distinct("application", {created: {$gte: new Date(new Date().setDate(new Date().getDate() - 60))}});
step.expectedresults: 1. Alert should trigger for the Applicatio, user should be directed to Creative upload page.

testcase.name: Check the Functionality of Daily Cap Hit Alert
testcase.summary: Check the Functionality of Daily Cap Hit Alert

step.actions: 1. Verify the reasons for the Daily Cap Hit Alert to trigger
step.expectedresults:
1. Daily Cap Alert should trigger 
  • if the Campaign has reached the Daily Spend Limit

step.actions:
Check for the Daily Cap Alert

  1. Create a Campaign in Grow with Daily Spend limit as 100.
  2. Pull above created Campaign in DB Mongo and modify the value of the field "dailySpent" to be greater than Daily Spend Limit, 100 or  dailySpendLimit - dailySpent <= 0
step.expectedresults:
1. Campaign should be created
  2. Daily spent value should be updated in DB and Daily Cap Alert should trigger in the Dashboard.

testcase.name: Verify the Daily Cap Alert for uncappped daily cap
testcase.summary: Verify the Daily Cap Alert for uncappped daily cap

step.actions: Verify the Daily Cap Alert for uncappped daily cap
step.expectedresults: Daily CAp Alert should not trigger for the Campaign  whose Daily CAp limit is uncapped.

testcase.name: Verify the Alerts for Inactive Campaigns and Apps
testcase.summary: Verify the Alerts for Inactive Campaigns and Apps
testcase.preconditions: Campaigns and Apps should be Inactive

step.actions: Verify the Alerts for Inactive Campaigns and Apps
step.expectedresults: Alerts should not trigger for Inactive/Archived CAmpaigns and Applications.
